theory: Kuma's High Hopes for Luffy Theory
description: After witnessing Luffy punch Saint Charlos at the auction house, Bartholomew Kuma developed high hopes that Luffy could become a hero capable of saving the world. This moment was pivotal in Kuma's decision-making process regarding his treatment of the Straw Hats, ultimately leading him to protect the Thousand Sunny for two years and sacrifice himself for their sake. Chapter 1102 revealed that Kuma started believing in Luffy's potential specifically after the Celestial Dragon punch.
author: One Piece Community
evidenceSupporting: Kuma's protective actions toward the Straw Hats after Sabaody
Chapter 1102 confirmation of Kuma's changed perspective on Luffy
Kuma's willingness to sacrifice himself for the crew

description: Chapter 1103 appears to deliberately parallel Kuma's stance when punching Saint Saturn with Luffy's iconic punch of Saint Charlos in episode 396. The similarities in posture and framing suggest Oda is creating a thematic callback, showing how Kuma learned from Luffy's defiance and courage. This would represent the ultimate catharsis for Kuma's suffering at the hands of the Celestial Dragons, with him finally taking the same stand that inspired him.
author: One Piece Community
evidenceSupporting: Similar character poses and panel framing
Thematic parallels between the two moments
Kuma witnessed Luffy's punch and was inspired by it

theory: The Separation Was Necessary for Growth Theory
description: The consequences of Luffy punching the Celestial Dragon - specifically the crew's separation and two-year timeskip - were necessary for the Straw Hats to survive in the New World. Without this forced separation triggered by the punch, the crew would not have undergone the individual training that made them strong enough for post-timeskip challenges. Luffy's moral choice, while seemingly reckless, ultimately saved the crew by forcing them to grow.
author: One Piece Fans
evidenceSupporting: All crew members became significantly stronger during separation
Each member trained specifically for their role
The crew would have died in the New World without this growth
evidenceAgainst: The crew might have found another way to train together
Rayleigh could have trained them all on Sabaody

description: Luffy punching a Celestial Dragon served as inspiration for the Revolutionary Army and oppressed people worldwide. The act demonstrated that the World Nobles are not untouchable divine beings but humans who can be held accountable for their actions. This symbolic act helped fuel the growing revolutionary movement and may have influenced Monkey D. Dragon's strategies. The punch serves as a wake-up call to the world that even the seemingly untouchable Celestial Dragons are not immune to justice.
author: Revolutionary Arc Theorists
evidenceSupporting: The Revolutionary Army's increased activity post-Marineford
Dragon's potential awareness of his son's actions
The global impact of news about the incident
evidenceAgainst: No direct evidence of Revolutionary Army response to this specific incident in the story
The news might have been suppressed by the World Government

theory: Law's Alliance Seeds Were Planted Here
description: Trafalgar Law's visible grin and approval when Luffy punched Saint Charlos planted the seeds for their future alliance. Law respects those who challenge corrupt authority and share his contempt for the World Government system. Witnessing Luffy's fearless defiance of the most untouchable authority in the world established mutual respect that would later develop into the Pirate Alliance during Punk Hazard and Dressrosa.
author: Alliance Theorists
evidenceSupporting: Law's visible positive reaction to the punch
Law later helping the Straw Hats escape Marineford
evidenceAgainst: Law might have planned the alliance for other strategic reasons
The alliance could be purely pragmatic rather than based on respect
